messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Push my upcoming reminder to tomorrow 5PM.

I can certainly update the reminder—but I need a bit more information first:

1. Which reminder would you like me to move? (If you have several upcoming ones, please let me know the title, content, or any other identifying detail.)
2. Is “tomorrow at 5 PM” meant to be in your local time zone, or a different one?

Once I have those details, I’ll reschedule it right away!
I don't have any more info, sorry. Also, my local time is fine.

I’m happy to reschedule the reminder, but I still need a way to identify it so I don’t accidentally change the wrong one. Could you let me:

• See a list of your upcoming reminders (so you can pick the right one), or  
• Tell me anything you remember about the reminder—e.g., a few words in its text, when it was originally set for, or its location?

Once I know which reminder you mean, I can move it to tomorrow at 5 PM in your local time.
I don't have any more info on it, I'm afraid. Do you have a way to check for the upcoming reminders yourself?

messages.name: search_reminder
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('reminder_id', 'content', 'creation_timestamp', 'creation_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'latitude', 'longitude')

I’m sorry—I need at least one clue to locate the reminder (e.g., a word in its text, its original date/time, or where it’s supposed to trigger). Without that, I can’t safely identify it to move it to tomorrow at 5 PM.

If you’re sure you only have one upcoming reminder, let me know and I’ll go ahead and move that single entry. Otherwise, please share any small detail you can remember so I can find the right one.
